article.title: The search for magnetic-induced charged currents in Pb--Pb collisions with ALICE

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Figure 1 depict regarding the pseudorapidity-odd component of directed flow (vₕ¹) in Pb-Pb collisions?
choices: It shows a significant increase in the slope d(vₕ¹)/dη with increasing collision energy.
It compares vₕ¹ for inclusive charged particles at √s<sub>NN</sub> = 5.02 TeV and 2.76 TeV, indicating a decrease in the slope with increasing energy.
It demonstrates no change in vₕ¹ between √s<sub>NN</sub> = 5.02 TeV and 2.76 TeV, suggesting energy independence.
It focuses on the centrality dependence of vₕ¹, highlighting a strong correlation between the two.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the key finding illustrated in Figure 2 regarding the charge dependence of vₕ¹ in Pb-Pb collisions at √s<sub>NN</sub> = 5.02 TeV?
choices: It shows no difference in vₕ¹ between positively and negatively charged particles.
It highlights a strong correlation between vₕ¹ and particle transverse momentum (p<sub>T</sub>).
It presents a possible charge dependence of vₕ¹, quantified as a difference in the slope d(vₕ¹)/dη with a significance of 2.6σ.
It focuses on the comparison of experimental data with theoretical predictions, showing a perfect agreement between the two.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the formula Avₕ¹(η) = k × η represent in the context of the study?
choices: It quantifies the centrality dependence of the directed flow.
It describes the relationship between vₕ¹ and particle transverse momentum.
It represents the linear fit applied to the charge difference in vₕ¹ as a function of pseudorapidity.
It calculates the total number of charged particles produced in the collision.
